data.scheme_name: Karnataka Tourism Policy 2020-26 - Caravan Park Project - General and Others - New
data.benefits: Capital Invesment Subsidy will be provided at 25% of Eligible Projects Cost, subject to a maximum of Rs 200 lakhs.
data.eligibility:
The Service Provider with minimum Eligible Project Cost (EPC) Investment of Rs. 25 lakhs
All tourism projects are eligible for capitl investment subsidy outside of Bengaluru Unban district.
data.conditions: Tourism Project must be undertaken on land owned by the Applicant to be eligible for Capital Investment Subsidy. However, Adventure Tourism Project and Wayside Amenities may be undertaken on leased land as well to be eligible for Capital Investment Subsidy. The term of the lease must be for a minimum of 10 years as on the date of application for In-Principle Approval.
data.beneficiaries:
The Service Provider with minimum Eligible Project Cost (EPC) Investment of Rs. 25 lakhs
All tourism projects are eligible for capitl investment subsidy outside of Bengaluru Unban district.
data.prerequisites:
The Tourism Project must commence operation as per the following timelines –
If the Eligible Project Cost is upto Rs. 5 Crore then in 2 years
If the Eligible Project Cost is more than Rs. 5 Crore then in 3 years
Tourism Project must be undertaken on land owned by the Applicant to be eligible for Capital Investment Subsidy. However, Adventure Tourism Project and Wayside Amenities may be undertaken on leased land as well to be eligible for Capital Investment Subsidy. The term of the lease must be for a minimum of 10 years as on the date of application for In-Principle Approval.
data.nodal_agency: Department of Tourism, Government of Karnataka
data.context: To provide a framework for Karnataka’s tourism industry to overcome ongoing difficulties, adapt to new norms, and remain competitive in the global tourism landscape.
data.objective: Karnataka aims to boost tourism for economic growth and employment, ensure visitor safety and comfort, promote globally, enhance infrastructure, attract private investments, and pursue sustainable development aligned with UN goals.
data.description:
Capital subsidy would be provided at the rate of 25% on Eligible Project Cost (EPC), subject to a maximum subsidy of Rs. 200 lakhs to the eligible service provider at Focus Tourism Destinations in Karnataka.
Additional 5% will be provided to differently abled entrepreneur.
data.how_to_apply:
The applicant can apply through the below link:
https://tourismpolicy.karnataka.gov.in/
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get incentive after the approval of the application by the concerned authority.
data.additional_info:
New Tourism Projects and Expansion Tourism Projects for only the following Eligible Tourism Projects shall be eligible for availing Capital Investment Subsidy under the Policy –
1. Adventure Tourism Project
2. Caravan Park Project
3. Caravan Tourism Project
4. Hotel Project – Budget (1-star or 2-star classification hotels / resorts)
5. Hotel Project – Premium (3-star or above classification hotels / resorts)
6. Houseboat Project
7. Wayside Amenities
8. Wellness Centre
data.checklist_info_a:
Business registration documents, financial statements, project proposals:-
Form for General Details of the Applicant 
Declaration by Applicant
Pro Forma for Application Form for Assistance for Sustainability Initiatives
Application for In-Principle Approval for Marketing Development Assistance 
Application for Final Approval for Marketing Development Assistance
Format for Event Report for Participation in Tourism, Travel or Hospitality Related Event
Format for Tour Report for Participation in Roadshows organized / sponsored by Karnataka Tourism
Sanction Order for Assistance for Sustainability Initiatives
Sanction Order for In-Principle Approval for Marketing Development Assistance 
Sanction Order for Final Approval for Approval for Marketing Development Assistance
Chartered Engineer / Valuer Certificate for Expenditure towards Sustainability Initiatives
Annexure 1 Verification Documents to be Submitted for various types of Applicant:-
Sole Proprietorship-
i. Registration certificate
ii. Certificate / License issued by Municipal Authorities under Shop and Establishment Act
iii. GST registration certificate of Proprietorship
iv. PAN of the Proprietor
Partnership Firm- 
i. Registration Certificate
ii. Partnership Deed
iii. PAN of the Partnership Firm
iv. GST registration certificate of Partnership Firm
v. Power of Attorney authorizing the individual submitting the application
Limited Liability Partnership (LLP)-
i. Certificate of Incorporation 
ii. Copy of LLP Agreement
iii. PAN of LLP
iv. GST registration certificate of LLP
v. Power of Attorney authorizing the individual submitting the application
Company (Private Limited or Public Limited)-
i. Certificate of Incorporation
ii. Memorandum & Articles of Association
iii. PAN of Company
iv. GST registration certificate of Company
v. Power of Attorney / Board Resolution authorizing the individual submitting the application
Trust / Association / Club / Society-
i. Copy of registration certificate with competent authority in India
ii. Declaration of Trust / Bye law of Trust / Association / Club / Society, as applicable
iii. PAN of Trust / Association / Club / Society, as applicable
iv. GST registration certificate of Trust / Association / Club / Society, as applicable
v. Power of Attorney authorizing the individual submitting the application
Hindu Undivided Family (HUF)-
i PAN of HUF
ii. Deed of declaration of HUF
iii. Identity proof of Karta / Existing authorized signatories
iv. GST registration certificate of HUF
Annexure 2 Government Order TOR 13 TDB 2021, Bangalore dated 31.01.2021
data.checklist_info_d:
Address: Department of Tourism, 4th floor/level,No 3, Embassy Icon, Infantry Road,Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001.
Contact: 080-2235 2828
Email: js1.tourism@gov.in
data.beneficiary: Specific Service Industry - All Entities - Karnataka - All MSMEs & All Non-MSMEs
data.lifecycle: Required Credit Support for Scale - Up
